title: Andrey Esipenko BLUNDERED the rook! Wei Yi moves on to World Cup Final!
excerpt: The dramatic blunder came in a sudden death tiebreak game, sending the Chinese GM Wei Yi to his first major final.

title: World Cup Final: The Battle Begins! Who Lands the First Blow in Game One?
excerpt: The two finalists, Wei Yi and Javokhir Sindarov, prepare to face off in the first long-awaited classical game.

title: Wei Yi: "It's One of My Biggest Goals in My Chess Career."
excerpt: The Chinese Grandmaster discusses the immense pressure and significance of earning a Candidates spot.

title: SLU Defeats UTD, Repeats as Collegiate Chess League Champions
excerpt: Saint Louis University clinched back-to-back Collegiate Chess League titles with a decisive victory over the University of Texas at Dallas.

title: Esipenko Hits Back To Lead Candidates Battle
excerpt: GM Andrey Esipenko struck back with a crucial win, reclaiming the lead in the Candidates qualification standings.

title: Gurel Cements Status As No. 1 Junior Bullet Brawler
excerpt: Turkish prodigy Deniz Gurel reaffirmed his dominance in bullet chess with another string of blisteringly fast wins.

title: Duda, Nakamura, Terry Win 3-0 Thursday
excerpt: A dominant Thursday saw Duda, Nakamura, and Terry each sweep their matches.

title: Firouzja Eliminates Nepomniachtchi, Advances To Semifinal Vs. Nakamura
excerpt: Alireza Firouzja knocked out Ian Nepomniachtchi in a fierce tiebreak to set up a blockbuster semifinal against Nakamura.

title: Final Round Drama: Both First-Leg Games End in Draws, Decisive Day Awaits
excerpt: The tension in the final round reached a new peak as both first-leg games ended in balanced draws, setting up a thrilling winner-take-all showdown the following day.

title: Yakubboev Resigns; Esipenko Stands One Step Away From Candidates Qualification
excerpt: In a dramatic turn of events, Nodirbek Yakubboev resigned in a critical position, bringing Andrey Esipenko within touching distance of a coveted Candidates spot.

title: Historic Moment Looms: Can Wei Yi Become the First Chinese Champion in the World Cup?
excerpt: All eyes turn to Wei Yi as he approaches a potentially historic milestoneâ€”no Chinese player has ever lifted the World Cup trophy, and tomorrow's result could change that narrative forever.

title: Lazavik Crushes Hans; Sets Up Next-Round Clash With Magnus
excerpt: Nikita Lazavik delivered a commanding victory over Hans Niemann, earning a high-stakes next-round matchup against Magnus Carlsen that has fans buzzing with anticipation.

title: Speed Chess Championship Semifinals Set: Lazavik, Magnus, Alireza, Hikaru to Battle in London
excerpt: The final four of the Speed Chess Championship are confirmed. In London, Lazavik, Magnus Carlsen, Alireza Firouzja, and Hikaru Nakamura will face off in a star-studded semifinal lineup.
